episodeTitle: I'll Save You Even If I Die - Luffy vs. The Marines, The Battle Starts
description: Luffy charges through Marine forces to reach Ace's execution platform, defeating Fullbody, Jango, and Captain Hina. As Ace desperately pleads with Luffy to retreat, Luffy declares he will save his brother even if it means death. Fleet Admiral Sengoku then reveals to the world that Luffy is the son of Revolutionary Dragon, shocking everyone at Marineford and beyond. Impressed by Luffy's determination, Whitebeard orders his crew to protect him.

events.title: Luffy Battles Fullbody and Jango
events.description: As Luffy charges toward Ace's execution platform, Fullbody and Jango attempt to stop him. Luffy initially doesn't recognize them, but when he recalls their previous humiliation, both marines become angry. By pure luck, Luffy avoids Jango's hypnotism by looking at a nearby explosion. Both Fullbody and Jango fall victim to Jango's hypnotism instead.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's single-minded determination to reach Ace, brushing past former antagonists who are now insignificant obstacles in his path.

events.title: Hina Attempts to Capture Luffy
events.description: After Hina kicks away the hypnotized Fullbody and Jango, she confronts Luffy, who recognizes her from Alabasta. Captain Hina uses her Ori Ori no Mi Devil Fruit abilities to try to imprison Luffy with her iron restraints, but Luffy manages to escape her capture by using Gear Second, quickly getting past her defenses.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's growth since Alabasta, as he easily overcomes a Marine captain who would have been a serious threat earlier in his journey.

events.title: New World Pirate Captains Debut
events.description: Four New World pirate captains allied with Whitebeard make their anime debut: Epoida (with caterpillar-themed Devil Fruit powers), Amadob (a large man in royal attire with an elaborate crown), Karma (captain of the Takotopus Pirates with an octopus theme), and Kinga (a tall man with brown hair and a thin mustache). They join the battle to rescue Ace.
events.significance: Expands the scope of the Marineford War by showing the diverse array of powerful allies Whitebeard has gathered from the New World.

events.title: Luffy Battles Multiple Vice Admirals
events.description: Luffy engages in combat with multiple Marine Vice Admirals simultaneously, including members of the Giant Squad such as Lacroix and Lonz. The Vice Admirals gang up on him in an attempt to prevent him from reaching Ace's execution platform.
events.significance: Shows the escalating difficulty of Luffy's charge through Marineford, as he faces increasingly powerful opponents.

events.title: Gecko Moria Resurrects Zombie Army
events.description: Gecko Moria commends Luffy's powers and plans to once again take his shadow, this time for Little Oars Jr. He uses his Kage Kage no Mi abilities to resurrect an army of zombies from fallen Marines and pirates to attack Luffy.
events.significance: Moria attempts to settle his score with Luffy from their encounter at Thriller Bark, adding another layer of danger to the battlefield.

events.title: Jinbe Defeats Moria's Zombies with Seawater
events.description: As Moria's zombies attack Luffy, Jinbe intervenes and defeats them using seawater. The salt purifies the zombies by removing the shadows that animate them, making Jinbe's fish-man abilities particularly effective. Jinbe tells Luffy that he will handle Moria.
events.significance: Shows Jinbe's support for Luffy and demonstrates the strategic advantage of fish-man abilities in this battle. Also establishes the alliance between Jinbe and Luffy.

events.title: Ace Begs Luffy to Retreat
events.description: Seeing Luffy in so much danger and overwhelmed by guilt, Ace screams at Luffy not to come closer. He pleads with his brother to stay away, saying they have both lived their lives and adventures according to how they wanted to, so Luffy shouldn't get involved any longer. Ace fears that Luffy will suffer the same fate as him.
events.significance: Shows the emotional depth of Ace and Luffy's brotherhood, with Ace prioritizing Luffy's safety over his own rescue. This moment highlights Ace's guilt and his desire to protect his younger brother.

quotes.text: Luffy, stop! We've both lived our lives the way we wanted! You don't need to get involved anymore!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace desperately trying to protect Luffy from danger

events.title: Flashback to Luffy and Ace's Sake Cup Brotherhood
events.description: A brief flashback shows the moment when Luffy and Ace officially consummated their brotherhood by sharing cups of sake. The scene hints at a third cup in the shadows, subtly foreshadowing Sabo's existence, though this is only barely visible in the anime compared to the manga.
events.significance: Reinforces the deep bond between Luffy and Ace that drives Luffy's determination to save his brother. The third cup serves as subtle foreshadowing for future revelations.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Giant Vice Admiral with Gear Third
events.description: Luffy uses his Gear Third technique to inflate his arm and deliver a powerful blow that defeats one of the giant Vice Admirals. After his victory, Luffy shouts at Ace that he will save him 'even if it means death,' demonstrating his unwavering resolve.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's determination and power growth, as he can now take down giant opponents. His declaration moves the Whitebeard Pirates and Whitebeard himself.

quotes.text: I'll save you even if it means death!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration to Ace after defeating a giant Vice Admiral

events.title: Whitebeard Orders His Crew to Protect Luffy
events.description: Thoroughly impressed by Luffy's determination and resolve to save Ace, Whitebeard orders Marco and his crew that no harm should come to Luffy. Whitebeard tells Marco they 'cannot let him die' after witnessing Luffy's declaration. The Whitebeard Pirates appreciate Luffy due to their common goal of saving Ace.
events.significance: Marks a crucial turning point where Whitebeard, one of the world's strongest pirates, recognizes Luffy's worth and commits to protecting him. This gives Luffy powerful allies in his rescue attempt.

quotes.text: Marco, we cannot let that boy die.
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard ordering the protection of Luffy

events.title: Sengoku Reveals Luffy is Dragon's Son
events.description: Annoyed by the turn of the war's tide and Luffy's progress toward the execution platform, Fleet Admiral Sengoku publicly reveals to everyone at Marineford and the world watching via Den Den Mushi that Luffy is the son of Monkey D. Dragon, the Revolutionary Army's leader and the World Government's most wanted criminal. Sengoku orders that Luffy must be stopped at all costs. This revelation shocks everyone present including Marines, pirates, the Shichibukai, and people watching at Sabaody Archipelago.
events.significance: One of the most significant revelations in the series, exposing Luffy's dangerous heritage to the world. This massively raises the stakes for Luffy's survival and explains why the World Government views him as such a threat. The revelation transforms how both allies and enemies perceive Luffy.

quotes.text: Straw Hat Luffy is the son of the Revolutionary Dragon! He must be stopped at all costs!
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku's shocking revelation to the world

events.title: Smoker Understands Why Dragon Saved Luffy at Loguetown
events.description: After hearing Sengoku's revelation that Luffy is Dragon's son, Smoker finally understands why the world's most wanted criminal personally intervened to save a rookie pirate at Loguetown. The mystery that has plagued Smoker since their encounter is now solved - Dragon was protecting his son. This realization intensifies Smoker's concerns about Luffy's dangerous potential.
events.significance: Provides context for Dragon's actions in Loguetown and shows how this revelation connects past events. It also demonstrates that Luffy has been unknowingly protected by his father's legacy.

events.title: World Reacts to Luffy's Heritage
events.description: The revelation of Luffy being Dragon's son spreads shock waves through the world. People at Sabaody Archipelago watching the broadcast are stunned. Marines are ordered to prioritize killing Luffy. The revelation establishes Luffy as not just a promising rookie pirate, but the son of the World Government's greatest enemy, fundamentally changing his status in the eyes of the world.
events.significance: This moment changes the entire world's perception of Luffy, elevating him from a dangerous rookie to a critical threat that combines the bloodlines of two of the world's most wanted individuals (Dragon and Gol D. Roger through Ace's brotherhood).

quotes.text: I'll save you even if it means death!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Luffy, stop! We've both lived our lives the way we wanted! You don't need to get involved anymore!
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace desperately trying to protect Luffy

quotes.text: Marco, we cannot let that boy die.
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard ordering the protection of Luffy

quotes.text: Straw Hat Luffy is the son of the Revolutionary Dragon! He must be stopped at all costs!
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: The shocking revelation that changes everything

themes.description: The episode powerfully explores the theme of brotherhood through Luffy and Ace's relationship. Ace wants Luffy to retreat to safety, while Luffy refuses to abandon his brother even at the cost of his own life.
themes.symbolism: The sake cup flashback symbolizes the unbreakable bond between Luffy and Ace, a promise that transcends blood relations.
culturalReferences: Japanese concept of brotherhood through sake cups

themes.description: The revelation of Luffy's parentage highlights the theme of inherited will and legacy. Luffy carries the blood of Dragon, the world's most wanted revolutionary, making him a symbol of potential upheaval.
themes.symbolism: Sengoku's public announcement represents how one's heritage can define how the world perceives them, regardless of personal actions.

themes.description: Luffy's refusal to give up despite overwhelming odds demonstrates his core character trait. His determination inspires both allies and enemies, earning him Whitebeard's respect.
themes.symbolism: Luffy charging through progressively stronger opponents represents his growth and his refusal to be stopped by any obstacle.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates tremendous growth and determination, fighting through Marine forces with single-minded focus on saving Ace. His declaration that he'll save Ace 'even if it means death' shows his absolute commitment to his brother.
keyActions: Escapes Captain Hina using Gear Second
Defeats a giant Vice Admiral with Gear Third
Declares he will save Ace even if it means death
Has his parentage revealed to the world
quotes: I'll save you even if it means death!

characterSpotlights.role: Condemned prisoner trying to protect Luffy
characterSpotlights.development: Ace's guilt and love for Luffy are on full display as he desperately begs Luffy to retreat. He values Luffy's life over his own freedom, showing the depth of their brotherhood.
keyActions: Screams at Luffy to stay away
Expresses guilt for putting Luffy in danger
Shown in flashback sharing sake cups with Luffy
quotes: Luffy, stop! We've both lived our lives the way we wanted! You don't need to get involved anymore!

characterSpotlights.development: Sengoku makes the strategic decision to reveal Luffy's parentage, hoping to turn the tide of battle by making Luffy a priority target.
keyActions: Observes the turning tide of battle
Reveals Luffy is Dragon's son to the world
Orders Marines to stop Luffy at all costs
quotes: Straw Hat Luffy is the son of the Revolutionary Dragon! He must be stopped at all costs!

characterSpotlights.development: Whitebeard shows his character by recognizing Luffy's worth and determination, ordering his crew to protect him despite Luffy not being part of his crew.
keyActions: Accepts Luffy as an ally in saving Ace
quotes: Marco, we cannot let that boy die.

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe continues to support Luffy's mission, using his abilities to protect Luffy from Moria's zombies and offering to handle Moria himself.
keyActions: Offers to handle Moria for Luffy

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, when Sengoku revealed that Luffy's father is Dragon, Mihawk and Doflamingo made comments while they did not say anything in the anime.
The manga showed a better hint of a third cup in Ace's flashback (with a clearer shadow), foreshadowing Sabo, while the anime only barely showed the shadow.

trivia.fact: Episode 467 received a television rating of 10.6%, ranking 3rd in its time slot, demonstrating the high viewership during the Marineford Arc.
The episode eyecatcher features Sanji and Luffy, highlighting Luffy's central role in this episode.
This episode adapts manga chapter 558 (pages 2-17), titled 'Little Brother', which perfectly encapsulates the theme of Luffy's determination to save his brother.

The revelation of Luffy being Dragon's son is considered one of the most shocking moments in One Piece, as it connects Luffy to the world's most wanted criminal and explains many mysteries from earlier in the series.
The US Funimation simulcast aired one day before the Japanese broadcast due to time zone differences.
